meanings.sent1: She was the stroppiest person in the office, always frowning and snapping at everyone.
meanings.sent2: The cat looked stroppiest when someone tried to pet it against its will.
meanings.sent3: Even the grumpy old bear seemed less stroppiest than her when she was in a bad mood.
meanings.sent4: His car, with its squeaky brakes and stubborn engine, was the stroppiest vehicle on the road.
meanings.sent5: The storm clouds gathered in a stroppiest manner, ready to unleash their fury.

meanings.definition: Showing a tendency to argue or be difficult
meanings.sent1: The stroppiest child in the class always had a counterargument for everything.
meanings.sent2: The teenager's stroppiest behavior made it hard for his parents to reason with him.
meanings.sent3: The stubborn goat was the stroppiest member of the herd, always wanting things its way.
meanings.sent4: The old rusty gate was the stroppiest entrance to the garden, often getting stuck halfway.
meanings.sent5: The river took the stroppiest route through the valley, winding and twisting unpredictably.

meanings.sent1: He was the stroppiest person to deal with when he hadn't had his morning coffee.
meanings.sent2: The cat was at its stroppiest when its food bowl was empty.
meanings.sent3: The computer seemed to be the stroppiest device in the office, crashing at the slightest provocation.
meanings.sent4: The old door was the stroppiest part of the house, creaking loudly at any movement.
meanings.sent5: The wind became stroppiest at sunset, howling and rattling the windows.
